articles.title: Cameron Norrie bounces back from Argentina Open final loss for easy Rio win
articles.description: The British No1 overcame an early wobble to win in straight sets over Juan Manuel Cerundolo
articles.content:
C ameron Norrie bounced back from defeat in the Argentina Open final on Sunday with a straight-sets victory over Juan Manuel Cerundolo at the Rio Open.

articles.title: Leo Messi to Rafael Nadal: ‘A great man like you leaves me speechless’
articles.description: Previously, Nadal had said that he was supporting Argentina and Lionel Messi to win the FIFA World Cup and how he was in tears after watching Messi lifting the World Cup.
articles.content:

articles.title: ‘Will be Leo’s decision’: Coach Scaloni hints at Lionel Messi’s future for Argentina
articles.description: Lionel Messi will be 39 for the 2026 World Cup to be held in the United States, Canada and Mexico.
articles.content:
Argentina’s World Cup-winning coach Lionel Scaloni hinted about the future of superstar Lionel Messi for the 2026 FIFA World Cup in the United States, Canada and Mexico.

articles.title: ‘An everyday thing’: a fatal beating reveals Argentina’s racist bias
articles.description: Fernando Báez Sosa, son of Paraguayan immigrants, was killed by men who screamed racist slurs as they kicked him to death
articles.content:
The murder of Fernando Báez Sosa rocked Argentina.
A nightclub altercation turned deadly as a group of amateur rugby players kicked to death an 18-year-old who dreamt of one day becoming a lawyer.

articles.title: GRAINS-Corn near 1-week high on Argentina supply woes, soybeans firm
articles.description: SINGAPORE, Feb 20 (Reuters) - Chicago corn futures rose on Tuesday, climbing to their highest in almost one week, as the market was underpinned by dry weather reducing supplies from key exporter Argentina.Soybeans gained ground and wheat ticked higher.FUNDAMENTALS* The most-active corn contract on the Chicago Board of Trade (CBOT) rose 0.3% to $6.79-1/2 a bushel, as of 0109
articles.content:
SINGAPORE, Feb 20 (Reuters) - Chicago corn futures rose on Tuesday, climbing to their highest in almost one week, as the market was underpinned by dry weather reducing supplies from key exporter Argentina.
Soybeans gained ground and wheat ticked high... [2258 chars]
